medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient started having pain on an unspecified date, which came and went, and worsened yesterday at 2 PM. The pain became more severe and constant, primarily in the right upper quadrant (RUQ), slightly in the epigastric area, and radiated to the right back. She has chills and a slightly decreased appetite, not having eaten since last night.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Schatzki's ring, eosinophilic esophagitis, ovarian cysts, migraines, urinary incontinence, liver mild focal mixed portal inflammation without fibrosis, lentigo, cystocele, rectocele, gout
medical_history.family_history: Positive for diabetes mellitus (DM), hyperlipidemia (HLD), cerebrovascular accident (CVA), coronary artery disease (CAD), leukemia, breast cancer; no gallbladder disease
